page.title: 01OUR AREA
page.content: {Our Area} Our twelve kilometre square consists mainly of farmland.In the North West corner it is crossed by a disused railway line.This railway line used to run from Boston to Spalding but was closed in 1970.The disused line is now overgrown and makes an excellent place for watching birds and other wildlife .There are plans to build a new road from Sutterton to Boston following the route of the old railway line.This work is to begin autumn 1985. There are two main settlements in the area.These are the villages of {Wyberton}and{Frampton.}Both are old villages which have grown considerably in the last twenty years.The original village of Wyberton is clustered around St.Leodegar's church while a new section of the village has grown up on the A16.
